title: Ticket #4432: Make COLLECTOR_PORT a config knob
description:
In HTCondor-CE, we use a different default collector port (9619) than HTCondor's default (mostly to avoid a conflict between the CE and the site batch system).

Unfortunately, all the client tools assume port 9618; for example,

condor_status -pool foo.example.com

uses port 9618 with no way to override.

We keep a very small wrapper around HTCondor binaries (condor_ping becomes condor_ce_ping) for the client to make sure that the appropriate config files are used. Hence, we could set a config knob such as:

COLLECTOR_PORT=9619

and have all the condor tools use that. Unfortunately, COLLECTOR_PORT is a C++ #define and not a config knob. Can this be changed?
remarks:
2014-Jul-01 11:18:44 by tannenba:
There are a few already existing ways that the tools can contact a collector on an alternate port:

  1. You can specify a port on the command line, e.g. condor_status -pool foo.edu:9619

  2. You can specify a port in the config file for CONDOR_HOST, e.g. CONDOR_HOST = foo.edu:9619

  3. When the collector starts up, it will drop a file log/.collector_address that contains the address and port the collector is listening on. If a client tool is told to connect to port 0 for the collector, perhaps by setting CONDOR_HOST = foo.edu:0 in the config file, this tells the tool to lookup the actual port number to use in the .collector_address file.

Are any of the above mechanisms applicable to what you want to do? Or do you still really want a COLLECTOR_PORT config knob. I am not against adding one if pre-existing functionality cannot do the job, but wanted to check.

2014-Jul-01 11:28:27 by bbockelm:
Yeah - none of those quite capture what I'm trying to do. Site admins are checking the config of their HTCondor-CE from a separate node by running: 

condor_ce_ping -pool foo.example.com -name foo.example.com

Since it's a remote CE host (and possibly one of several), probably can eliminate options (2) and (3) outlined above.

Option (1) works, but I want to have things "work by default". The site admin was confused because he doesn't have to specify the default port for running condor_ping against his site but he has to specify the default port (9619) for condor_ce_ping.

2014-Jul-14 19:57:44 by bbockelm:
Pushed as V8_1-gt4432. Todd, can you review?

2014-Jul-15 12:46:10 by bbockelm:
Code Review (from Todd and Jaime on phone):
  • Let's go ahead and document this.
  • In the param table, allow "0" (for binding to a random port).
  • Add back COLLECTOR_PORT as a define to not scatter 9618 constant.
  • Consensus was that this shouldn't break std univ.
